alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Lucie, eastern Okeechobee, eastern Indian River and northwestern Martin Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Fort Drum, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Pierce, Sebastian, Vero Beach, Treasure Island, and Okeechobee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
